thinking.disposable_income: West Ridge has a mixed-income population with median household income around $54,000. About 18% of residents live below poverty level. Many residents are price-sensitive to transportation costs.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Moderate levels of discretionary spending. The community has significant immigrant populations who tend to be cost-conscious. Many households need to carefully budget transportation expenses.
thinking.accessibility: Good bus service along major arterials but limited rail access. About 30% of households don't own cars and rely on transit. Many residents commute to jobs downtown and other parts of the city. Walking access to local shopping districts on Devon and Western.
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritize lower transit fares ($0.75) to help transit-dependent residents while maintaining service quality. 2. Moderate tax rate (1%) balances revenue needs with household budgets. 3. Support modest driving fees ($0.50-$1.00) to reduce congestion and fund transit without overly burdening drivers. 4. Focus on proposals that reduce transit travel times to help commuters. 5. Consider proposals that maintain reasonable driving costs for car-dependent households while encouraging transit use.
